text: "Greetings commander. It's good to finally run into someone who doesn't want to kill us."
"So, another vulture has mistaken us for carrion. You're not the first to make that mistake. Do your worst."
"So, another vulture has mistaken us for carrion. You're not the first to make that mistake. Do your worst."
"I'll be frank with you. We need your cargo and I don't see much reason not to take it. Surrender now and your lives will be spared."
"Keep your fleet at a polite distance and we'll do the same. The last thing we need is another enemy."
"Greetings, commander. It is always good to see a fellow guardian of the Citadel."
"The resources of the Citadel are at your disposal, commander, but remember; even you can overstay your welcome here. I hope you will forgive us our secrecy."
"The fleets of the Idoneus Citadel do not interfere with the affairs of the sector. I suggest that you don't interfere with in ours."
"The Citadel will not yield to outsiders, commander. We shall not succumb to you so easily."
"You have trespassed, commander. I don't know what you're looking for near the Citadel, but your search ends here."
"The Idoneus Citadel does not deal with outsiders. You should leave before you encounter a Citadel fleet commander less forgiving than I."

You arrive at a bar where you think you can get the most information, but the place is sparsely populated and not at all as noisy as it should be. You learn from talking to one of the merchants in the corner that such places were not very popular until the fleet left hyperspace and arrived in some galactic space.

The Remnant fleet seems to have been unprepared for your appearance, as they quickly retreat and regroup, with their reinforcements on the periphery gradually moving into battle position, turning the battlefield into a sea of Remnants in no time.
Your adjutant reluctantly mutes his comms and turns to look at you, "Looks like we're trapped, your orders?"

text: Out of nowhere, a massive signature pops up on the sensors, sending everyone into a panic - until a familiar face pops up on the screen. "Hey," Carobin says, "We've been doing fine...until we ran into this goddamned siege. If you are here to help, you have my thanks!"

"Enough said; the Fleet Admiral has declared maximum alert and the whole fleet is, well, its marshalling for battle!" As the comm link cuts, reports come in; ther Idonean Exile fleet has leveraged the opportunity to take up positions, with the ships you've provided among them. The tension builds; as the sensorscape paints a picture of greatly forming force, the determination of your allies puts more and more presure on you.

The fleet is in a state of complete readiness, all mobile ports used for docking have been sealed off and market and repair areas have been urgently closed and requisitioned. You are unable to make any further moves until the situation is resolved.
